synopsis.text:
On the brink of adulthood, 17-year-old Akihiko Nomura, affectionately known as Bobby, finds solace and passion in the throbbing engines and sleek frames of motorcycles. Struggling academically and with a father who insists on a college education, Bobby's world revolves around his two-wheeled companion. His silent mother and cheerful younger sister, Keiko, watch from the sidelines as he spends countless hours maintaining and riding his bike.

When a photograph of Bobby's road trip is featured in a motorcycle magazine, an unexpected connection is sparked. A young girl named Nakahara Sakumi, captivated by the image, pens a heartfelt letter to him, igniting a correspondence that introduces romance into Bobby's otherwise monotonous life.

Despite his father's persistent efforts to steer him towards higher education, Bobby's unwavering dedication to motorcycles leads him down a different path. He quits school and begins working at a biker bar, only to find himself estranged from his family. Amidst the chaos, a phone call from his mystery pen pal promises to change the course of his life, leading to an unforeseen turn of events at a motocross track.

Embark on a journey with Bobby as he navigates the complexities of adolescence, family expectations, and newfound love, all while pursuing his undying passion for motorcycles.
